Train a model with prediction head on STS-B Store this model with model.save_pretrained(output_dir) Load this model with the following code
config = AutoConfig.from_pretrained(load_path) model = RobertaModelWithHeads.from_pretrained(load_path, config=config) The config from AutoConfig (line 1) shows the head: "prediction_heads": { "sts-b": { "activation_function": "tanh", "head_type": "classification", "layers": 2, "num_labels": 1 } } The config of the RobertaModelWithHeads removes the head from the config: <denchmark-code> "prediction_heads": {}, </denchmark-code>
Apparently the weights of the head are also not loaded: >>> [(k,v) for (k,v) in model.named_parameters() if 'bert' not in k] [] However, they are in the pickled checkpoint file: >>> import torch >>> x = torch.load(in_dir + '/pytorch_model.bin') >>> [k for k in x.keys() if 'bert' not in k] ['heads.sts-b.1.weight', 'heads.sts-b.1.bias', 'heads.sts-b.4.weight', 'heads.sts-b.4.bias'] <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Model also loads the prediction head of the checkpoint. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment info</denchmark-h>
